p: The floral buds of S. aromaticum were purchased from the central market of the city of São Luís, Maranhão, Brazil (2° 31′ 48″ S, 44° 18′ 10″ W). For the extraction of oil, dry flower buds were selected in an oven with air circulation at 37 °C/48 h, and soon afterwards they were sprayed in a knife mill in the Physics-Chemistry Laboratory of the Food and Water Quality Control Program (PCQA), Federal University of Maranhão.
